overview_of_class: This course examines the cognitive, neurobiological, and linguistic aspects of bilingualism. We will examine topics such as; the acquisition of two or more languages by children and adults; the brain mechanisms involved in bilingual language processing; how bilinguals control what linguistic system they use to guide processing; and the consequences of bilingualism for other aspects of cognition.
name: Bilingualism
title: WCAS LING 321-0-20 Bilingualism
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for students who have taken and passed Ling 250 or 260 or 270, or Cog Sci 210 to register for this course. Otherwise, permission of the instructor is required.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Recognize the structure of cognitive, linguistic, and neuroscientific theories of bilingual language processing; learn how to connect such theories to empirical data.
